topic.title: Funny Thing Happening with my Gmail Account. Any Ideas? Anyone Else?
topic.body:
I am getting new emails at a rate of 1/minute from someone (partially) signing up for all kinds of accounts using my email. I never click the activation link. The 2 usernames used in the sign up process are consistent, but the web accounts the person is signing me up for include:
-Hockey
-Birdwatching
-Travel Agencies
-Video Production Companies
-Graphic Art Companies
-Lord of the Rings Trading Cards
-Hotel Companies
-Restaurants in Central America

None of which I have signed up for.

Have I become the victim of a strange trolling campaign?  Why would someone be using my email to sign up for accounts all day that they can't activate?

Any insight is appreciated.

topic.title: Official Shill, Troll, and Disinfo Agent Tracking and Muting Thread
topic.body:
There have been an influx of shills, trolls, disinfo agents on ZeroNet. 

Clearly this technology is a threat to anyone trying to hide a secret, to anyone that doesn't want to be exposed. There are staffing agencies all over that specialize in hiring shills for any platform you desire.

I see a lot of users who don't contribute anything to ZeroNet except trying to dissuade people from gathering information or educating themselves on items that they don't want people to know about. They spread FUD and specialize in de-cohesion of communities. They utilize ad hominem in order to demotivate users.

>Are you schizophrenic
>Do you need to see a psychiatrist
Derailing threads or linking to unrelated threads

These are the mark of the beast. List here any and all users that are shills, trolls, or disinfo agents so that we may collectively mute them. 

Do your part and when you spot a shill, troll, disinfo agent, put their name here so we can mute them.

Please provide fact-based evidence for why this person should be muted.

Is anything coming out or happening that you are particularly joyful for or looking forward to?

topic.title: Policing Reform in the United States- What is your Answer?
topic.body:
My answer to this problem?

It's all about the current system's invisible hand that encourages abuse and coverups. Also, being people, there will be some good some bad. It seems, though, to be an industry that attracts knuckleheads. During the intelligence battery test for police, it is very easy to score too high and not be eligible for policework. They want grunts that are incapable of thinking for themselves.

Police are necessary, but given my life experiences, I say fuck 'em all to hell. I honestly think people could do a decent job policing themselves in certain regions. In big cities, however it would be absolute chaos.

Instead of our current, deleterious to health system, create a rating-based system where if your rating drops below a certain threshold, you are barred from working and do not get your $25,000 policeman's deposit back. Every interaction gets rated.

Physical abuse/murder after swearing an oath to protect and serve should result in immediate life detainment in maximum security prison. This can bypass due process with a document that must be signed by newly hired officers.

Proven wrongful incarceration should result in 25 years prison time served by the presiding district attorney, with all assets gained from employment stripped and distributed to the wrongfully accused.

> [aeldg7pg4b](#comment_29_1NdJyMSqnWWim7ibxBvaNsMgQvqkkTXVnz): Freenet seems to be dying, but Zeronet still has a pulse. [...]

This is true. I still support Freenet by having a huge datastore and having it sharing all the time. I think it is worthy of knowing about and exploring from a historical and technical standpoint. I will always love Freenet and it's use of plugins like Sone, Frost, MuWire, FMS.

I2p is my favorite 'othernet', though they all have different use cases, benefits, operational models, etc.
I2p, Tor, Freenet, Zeronet, Retroshare, OpenBazaar, DAT, IPFS, are all worthy of using and supporting, though not all for the same purposes.

And many people has been killed by Christians too (the majority during the Crusades between 1095-1495), so Christianity is not better in this aspect. Religions are not bad. Certain people are.

Taqiya is a doctrine of lying in islam. you were likely lied to about all facets of the religion. its all about violent global domination if you know a damn thing about what you are saying. All religion is bad, especially islam, which is a stone-age hate-filled religion. mohammad himself raped 6 year old girls, as stated in the koran. killing non-muslims is also both okay and encouraged.
get a handle on what you are dealing with and then we can discuss.

islam is the single largest 'religion' and the single largest threat to humanity and human progress

i use the term religion loosely because islam is designed to be a thought-virus, where violence awaits those who do not accept to spread the virus

1568941688_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
It's not so much that reality as we know it is a simulation, but rather reality at it's core is a simulation. What keeps laws of physics from breaking? What keeps track of a given atom's inertia? What keeps gravity from accelerating a given mass at a rate greater than 9.8 m/s^2? etc etc
Definitions, constants, rules, routines, loops-
These are all things we see in our natural world and in computer programs.

This simulation is not likely perpetuated by a computer in any sense that we could conceive of.

What would you say about someone with epilepsy? Do they deserve to fear pissing themselves and thrashing violently on the daily?
